body:
They also banned JG permanently for a 7 day offense.

Also users like dgk, firexq, and jason never broke any rules, cap just made shit up. Ali never did either but I can see how that incident looked like it so I'll let that slide.

Klenny never broke the rules either, the admins made up the rule *afterwards* and then retroactively banned him for it! And ironically one of his punishments was that cap doxxed him and revealed sensitive information about him and his alts, even though cap banned jason for "doxxing" someone by mentioning their name which is listed on all their social media pages.

parent.body:
i feel mixed about this.
  
Yeah definitely favoritism.
  
on the other hand, can you expect any different from humankind?
  
No, no you cant.
   
Plan ahead, that's my suggestion. 
  
Then again, those you mentioned did break rules. You dont agree with those rules apparently. I love Klen. I actually do. Reminds me of young me. But he did post nsfw shit in a non nsfw place. I disagreed with the severity of the punishment. From what i understand, it was shortened.
  
JG did have alts. They did manage more than 3 guilds. Says thats against the very few rules we have. The managing more guilds, specifically.
  
Thats the reddit that kek and capt dont want. Its the reddit their rules prevent.

JG did have alts. They did manage more than 3 guilds. Says thats against the very few rules we have. The managing more guilds, specifically.

Thats the reddit that kek and capt dont want. Its the reddit their rules prevent.

body: I definitely think so. I also think that in these cases the permaban for alts should only be if that alt was used for evading the rules. Clearly JG's purpose was much more than just modding more guilds, so if it is indeed his alt I don't think it's fair to permaban it in this case. If the alt was used only to evade something then yeah, a permaban makes sense, but that was not the case this time.

body:
> Maybe if y'all stopped using alts to violate the 10 guild limit and getting permab& for TOS this wouldn't keep happening.

It's supposed to be a 7 day ban. He got a permanent ban. Also the first person banned for this was banned after the admins retroactively added the rule and *then* banned them, and not only that, but doxxed him and told everyone all of his alts, some of which were sensitive.

> Is this all one person?

No

body:
That is literally reddit/AHS logic. "There has to be moderation!!!!!!!!!!" they say. It's a "compromise" that was completely involuntary.

Was ruqqus made to compromise like all the other sites, or to finally be free?

I get kicking off-topic posts from a guild. I understand not allowing dox (which cap engages in himself ironically). But like in any system, "there has to be rules!" is often used as an excuse to be tyrannical. You can cover any abuse of power under this, and it will become absolute power. The admins need to follow their own rules, not have double standards, not give anyone special treatment, and not use loopholes to ban users they don't like and pull off shenanigans that anyone else would be permanently kicked off the site for. And we need to stop backing abusive power users like carp who exile anyone they don't like and trash things for fun at everyone elses' expense.
body_html:
That is literally reddit/AHS logic. "There has to be moderation!!!!!!!!!!" they say. It's a "compromise" that was completely involuntary.

Was ruqqus made to compromise like all the other sites, or to finally be free?

I get kicking off-topic posts from a guild. I understand not allowing dox (which cap engages in himself ironically). But like in any system, "there has to be rules!" is often used as an excuse to be tyrannical. You can cover any abuse of power under this, and it will become absolute power. The admins need to follow their own rules, not have double standards, not give anyone special treatment, and not use loopholes to ban users they don't like and pull off shenanigans that anyone else would be permanently kicked off the site for. And we need to stop backing abusive power users like carp who exile anyone they don't like and trash things for fun at everyone elses' expense.

parent.body:
There are two paradigms: Curation and Freedom

Curation results in higher quality content, at the expense of freedom. 

Freedom results in unfiltered feeds, no censorship, with lower quality content. 

Ruqqus has made a compromise between the two. The guildmaster system permits some level of curation, while forbidding comment removal, also limiting direct administrator control. Ruqqus is infinitely better than Reddit in every conceivable way if you value free speech. If you want absolute freedom (within the constraints of government law) you would be better looking at something like Poal or 8chan. Which are entirely anonymous, decentralized, and kind of cesspools. 

I have a fairly active community on Reddit. The most benign subject imaginable. Yet I get adult sex workers, advertisers from Amazon, and more. If I left my subreddit uncurated (uncensored) it would be a cesspool. 

People fail to recognize the systemic problem associated with zero curation. If you allow people (generally speaking) to do whatever they want, you have anarchy. /r/History/ starts talking about dicks, +Ruqqus starts posting about jews. 

The administrators make an effort to facilitate this compromise. But one must understand that it is in fact a compromise.
parent.body_html:
There are two paradigms: Curation and Freedom

Curation results in higher quality content, at the expense of freedom.

Freedom results in unfiltered feeds, no censorship, with lower quality content.

Ruqqus has made a compromise between the two. The guildmaster system permits some level of curation, while forbidding comment removal, also limiting direct administrator control. Ruqqus is infinitely better than Reddit in every conceivable way if you value free speech. If you want absolute freedom (within the constraints of government law) you would be better looking at something like Poal or 8chan. Which are entirely anonymous, decentralized, and kind of cesspools.

I have a fairly active community on Reddit. The most benign subject imaginable. Yet I get adult sex workers, advertisers from Amazon, and more. If I left my subreddit uncurated (uncensored) it would be a cesspool.

People fail to recognize the systemic problem associated with zero curation. If you allow people (generally speaking) to do whatever they want, you have anarchy. /r/History/ starts talking about dicks, +Ruqqus starts posting about jews.

The administrators make an effort to facilitate this compromise. But one must understand that it is in fact a compromise.

parent.body:
>It's a 7-day ban, not a permanent one; yet he was permabanned.

His main was the only one that was tempbanned. Admittingly, I don't know what his main account is. Nor what classifies an account as a main account.

>Hopefully he's genuinely changed his mind about doing that.

he did, admitted it was a mistake on discord. calling it doxxing is a stretch.

>Also it could've just been an accident, what if he modded 5 guilds on each and unthinkingly made a sixth on one of his accounts?

i kinda doubt that the admins would outright ban for that unless you doing something like moderating 10 guilds on your main and some others spread across your alts

None of this would have happened if jg hadn't broken this part of the terms;

>You are permitted to create and use multiple ruqqus.com accounts.

>You will not use multiple accounts to circumvent per-user limits. Examples of such limits include, but are not limited to:

>    Maximum one upvote or downvote per post or comment
>    Maximum ten Guilds moderated at one time
>    Maximum two Guilds created per day

>Additionally, these terms apply to all of your accounts, which may exist now or in the future. Ruqqus LLC reserves the right to take administrative action against all of your accounts in the event of a terms of service violation on any of your accounts.

Stuff like this happens.
parent.body_html:
It's a 7-day ban, not a permanent one; yet he was permabanned.

His main was the only one that was tempbanned. Admittingly, I don't know what his main account is. Nor what classifies an account as a main account.

Hopefully he's genuinely changed his mind about doing that.

he did, admitted it was a mistake on discord. calling it doxxing is a stretch.

Also it could've just been an accident, what if he modded 5 guilds on each and unthinkingly made a sixth on one of his accounts?

i kinda doubt that the admins would outright ban for that unless you doing something like moderating 10 guilds on your main and some others spread across your alts

None of this would have happened if jg hadn't broken this part of the terms;

You are permitted to create and use multiple ruqqus.com accounts.

You will not use multiple accounts to circumvent per-user limits. Examples of such limits include, but are not limited to:

Maximum one upvote or downvote per post or comment Maximum ten Guilds moderated at one time Maximum two Guilds created per day

Additionally, these terms apply to all of your accounts, which may exist now or in the future. Ruqqus LLC reserves the right to take administrative action against all of your accounts in the event of a terms of service violation on any of your accounts.

Stuff like this happens.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

parent.body:
We're in admin chat discussing this GM/alt scenario moving forward.

So after klen, we revised the ToS to communicate that you cannot use multiple accounts to bypass certain limitations such as guild modding. However, I believe it's important to have a strict protocol on defining which is an alt.

@captainmeta4 went by account age to determine JG's alts v main, which isn't that good of an indicator as compared to vote, comment, and posting activity. Unfortunately, this means JG's current guilds were not protected as JG wasn't the "main account", the account with earliest sign up timestamp.

imo JG was more of main account if we're going off activity rather than account creation.

Might have to include how determine a main vs an alt moving forward if we're going to be placing bans on them, and that could put an account's guilds at risk. Maybe even a siege cool down for guilds that were modded by a banned user, so they can't be immediately shit on by others.
parent.body_html:
We're in admin chat discussing this GM/alt scenario moving forward.

So after klen, we revised the ToS to communicate that you cannot use multiple accounts to bypass certain limitations such as guild modding. However, I believe it's important to have a strict protocol on defining which is an alt.

@captainmeta4 went by account age to determine JG's alts v main, which isn't that good of an indicator as compared to vote, comment, and posting activity. Unfortunately, this means JG's current guilds were not protected as JG wasn't the "main account", the account with earliest sign up timestamp.

imo JG was more of main account if we're going off activity rather than account creation.

Might have to include how determine a main vs an alt moving forward if we're going to be placing bans on them, and that could put an account's guilds at risk. Maybe even a siege cool down for guilds that were modded by a banned user, so they can't be immediately shit on by others.

body: Lol the mods in the discord are all focus group members and guildmasters on the admins guilds, and they are allowed to break the rules with zero consequences. And the admins blatantly let them talk in #golden-lounge without premium and private channels without earning access, and you bet that they abuse it. They also get around all the word filters and slowmodes and get write access to the github repo and have private discussions with the admins and see deleted messages and have access to non-public info about ruqqus and just every kind of special privilege. The admins even planned on letting them administratively remove posts but they scrapped it when I told everyone about it and then claimed it was never a thing.

parent.body:
I never thought I would see this day. Do you think that alts should be permabanned at all? (Maybe they can get the person to choose the guilds they like the best, get them to choose the account they like the best, make them the GM of those guilds on that account (the "main account"), remove all the other guilds from their alts, and only ban the alts for 7 days, like the main account. This may be a bit hard to accomplish without PMs or anything like that though. I just don't really like that all these accounts are being banned. I liked looking at fifthfiend's post history to look for complaints about ruqqus censorship, and I can't do that anymore.)

If that's not going to happen, I agree that posting activity should be the indicator of what is the "main account", and I also think that alts should only be permabanned if they were actually used for evading the 10 guild limit.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
parent.body_html:
I never thought I would see this day. Do you think that alts should be permabanned at all? (Maybe they can get the person to choose the guilds they like the best, get them to choose the account they like the best, make them the GM of those guilds on that account (the "main account"), remove all the other guilds from their alts, and only ban the alts for 7 days, like the main account. This may be a bit hard to accomplish without PMs or anything like that though. I just don't really like that all these accounts are being banned. I liked looking at fifthfiend's post history to look for complaints about ruqqus censorship, and I can't do that anymore.)

If that's not going to happen, I agree that posting activity should be the indicator of what is the "main account", and I also think that alts should only be permabanned if they were actually used for evading the 10 guild limit.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]
